metadata.title: CVE-2016-2522 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
The dissect_ber_constrained_bitstring function inepan/dissectors/packet-ber.c in the ASN.1 BER dissector in Wireshark 2.0.xbefore 2.0.2 does not verify that a certain length is nonzero, which allowsremote attackers to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds read andapplication crash) via a crafted packet.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-2522` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwireshark-data - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu18.04.1
libwireshark11 - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu18.04.1
libwiretap8 - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu18.04.1
libwscodecs2 - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu18.04.1
libwsutil9 - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu18.04.1
tshark - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu18.04.1
wireshark - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu18.04.1
wireshark-common - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu18.04.1
wireshark-gtk - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu18.04.1
wireshark-qt - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wireshark package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.6.3-1~ubuntu18.04.1').
